conclusion: Analyze the slope of v-t graphs to determine acceleration changes.
Red lines represent tangent lines at different points on v-t graphs for A and B.
Slope of tangent line on v-t graph gives instantaneous acceleration.
Positive slope indicates positive acceleration; negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
First tangent line for A has positive slope, indicating increasing acceleration.
Second tangent line for A has smaller positive slope, indicating decreasing acceleration.
First tangent line for B has positive slope, indicating increasing acceleration.
Second tangent line for B has smaller positive slope, indicating decreasing acceleration.
Slopes of tangent lines for both A and B transition from larger positive to smaller positive values.
Accelerations of both objects first increase and then decrease.
